intro: Philodendron hylaeae, commonly known as the Hylaean Philodendron, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are typically a deep green with a velvety texture. The plant has a climbing habit and produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by bright red berries. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Philodendron hylaeae thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
